docna.cdata!:
Honduras - North Road Project : Credit 0071
            - Credit Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Honduras - North Road Project :
            Credit 0071  - Credit Agreement - Conformed

docna.cdata!:
Honduras - North Road Project : Loan 0400 -
            Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Honduras - North Road Project :
            Loan 0400 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The project consists of the construction
            of a two-lane bituminous surfaced road totaling about 202
            kms in length and a bridge with its accesses over the Ulua
            River and the provision of associated engineering services.
            The North Road has been given the highest priority both in
            the National and Central American regional highway
            investment program. One-third of Honduras' total
            population live in its zone of influence, where the main
            cities and most of the country's manufacturing and
            processing facilities are located, as well as about one
            quarter of the country's total farm area. The North
            Road will replace a narrow winding gravel road. Assuming a
            reasonable annual rate of increase in road traffic, the
            design of the road would ensure adequate capacity to
            accommodate future traffic subject to certain relatively
            minor improvements of the pavement to be made in due course.
